question: Which country houses the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Vatnajokull National Park"?
explanation: Vatnajokull National Park is one of three national parks in Iceland. It encompasses all of the Vatnajokull glacier and extensive surrounding areas. The unique qualities of Vatnajokull National Park are primarily its great variety of landscape features, created by the combined forces of rivers, glacial ice, and volcanic and geothermal activity. On 5 July 2019, Vatnajokull National Park was inscribed as a World Heritage Site.
